gv.name: Govern
gv.description: The organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy are established, communicated, and monitored

GV.OC.name: Organizational Context
GV.OC.description: The circumstances (mission, stakeholder expectations, dependencies, and legal/regulatory requirements) surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood

subcategories.GV.OC-01: The organizational mission is understood and informs cybersecurity risk management
subcategories.GV.OC-02: The organizational structure and resource allocation for cybersecurity are understood
subcategories.GV.OC-03: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity are understood and managed
subcategories.GV.OC-04: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services that stakeholders depend on or expect from the organization are understood and communicated
subcategories.GV.OC-05: Outcomes, roles, and responsibilities for cybersecurity risk management are established, communicated, and enforced

GV.RM.name: Risk Management Strategy
GV.RM.description: The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions

subcategories.GV.RM-01: Cybersecurity risk management strategy is established, communicated, and enforced throughout the organization
subcategories.GV.RM-02: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are established, communicated, and maintained
subcategories.GV.RM-03: Risk management roles and responsibilities are established and communicated
subcategories.GV.RM-04: Strategic direction and priorities for cybersecurity risk management are established and communicated
subcategories.GV.RM-05: Lines of communication across the organization are established for cybersecurity issues, including escalation pathways for cybersecurity issues
subcategories.GV.RM-06: The risk management strategy addresses cybersecurity risks to critical capabilities, services, and the supply chain
subcategories.GV.RM-07: Risk management strategy is informed by cybersecurity threat intelligence and information on vulnerabilities and threat actor tactics, techniques, and procedures

GV.RR.name: Roles and Responsibilities
GV.RR.description: Cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and authorities to foster accountability, performance assessment, and continuous improvement are established and communicated

subcategories.GV.RR-01: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are established, communicated, and enforced throughout the organization
subcategories.GV.RR-02: Roles and responsibilities for cybersecurity risk management are coordinated across the organization
subcategories.GV.RR-03: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and other external stakeholders are established, communicated, and enforced
subcategories.GV.RR-04: Roles and responsibilities to support cybersecurity risk management are integrated into an organizational structure

GV.PO.name: Policy
GV.PO.description: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established, communicated, and enforced

subcategories.GV.PO-01: Policy for cybersecurity is established based on organizational context, cybersecurity strategy, and priorities and is communicated throughout the organization
subcategories.GV.PO-02: Cybersecurity policy addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and compliance

GV.OV.name: Oversight
GV.OV.description: Results of organization-wide cybersecurity risk management activities and performance are used to inform, improve, and adjust the governance strategy

subcategories.GV.OV-01: Cybersecurity risk management strategy outcomes are reviewed to inform and adjust strategy and direction
subcategories.GV.OV-02: Cybersecurity strategy outcomes are reviewed to inform and adjust strategy and direction
subcategories.GV.OV-03: Organizational cybersecurity posture is compared with and adjusted based on the posture of peer organizations and authoritative sources

GV.SC.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
GV.SC.description: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management processes are established, implemented, and monitored

subcategories.GV.SC-01: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, strategy, objectives, policies, and processes are established
subcategories.GV.SC-02: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and other stakeholders are established, communicated, and coordinated internally and externally
subcategories.GV.SC-03: Contractual agreements with suppliers are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of the cybersecurity supply chain risk management program
subcategories.GV.SC-04: Suppliers are evaluated and selected based on their security posture and ability to meet contractual cybersecurity requirements
subcategories.GV.SC-05: Requirements to address cybersecurity risks in supply chains are established, prioritized, and integrated into contracts and supplier relationships
subcategories.GV.SC-06: Planning includes supply chain risk management considerations related to the organization's critical capabilities, services, and assets
subcategories.GV.SC-07: The cybersecurity supply chain risk management program includes policies and procedures to guide response efforts during supply chain compromise events
subcategories.GV.SC-08: The organization assesses supplier's cybersecurity practices and performance to determine compliance with contractual obligations
subcategories.GV.SC-09: Response and recovery planning includes the supplier and customer ecosystem
subcategories.GV.SC-10: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management plans include provisions for periodic review of contracts and supplier relationships

id.name: Identify
id.description: The organization's current cybersecurity posture is understood through identifying and assessing assets, vulnerabilities, and threats

ID.AM.name: Asset Management
ID.AM.description: Assets (data, hardware, software, systems, facilities, services, people) that support business objectives are identified, cataloged, and managed throughout their lifecycle

subcategories.ID.AM-01: Physical devices and systems are inventoried within the organization
subcategories.ID.AM-02: Software platforms, applications, and services are inventoried within the organization
subcategories.ID.AM-03: Communication and data flows are cataloged
subcategories.ID.AM-04: External information systems and services are cataloged
subcategories.ID.AM-05: Assets are prioritized based on their importance to business objectives and the organization's risk strategy
subcategories.ID.AM-06: Roles and responsibilities for asset management are established, assigned, and communicated
subcategories.ID.AM-07: Asset criticality, locations, network connections, and custodians are documented
subcategories.ID.AM-08: Hardware assets are securely disposed of or transitioned throughout their lifecycle

ID.RA.name: Risk Assessment
ID.RA.description: The organization understands cybersecurity risk to organizational operations, organizational assets, and individuals

subcategories.ID.RA-01: Organizational context and cybersecurity risk appetite are established and communicated
subcategories.ID.RA-02: Potential internal and external cybersecurity threats to the organization are identified and characterized
subcategories.ID.RA-03: Internal and external vulnerabilities are identified and characterized
subcategories.ID.RA-04: Potential impacts and consequences of threats exploiting vulnerabilities are identified and characterized
subcategories.ID.RA-05: Threats, vulnerabilities, impacts, and consequences are analyzed to determine risk
subcategories.ID.RA-06: Risk responses are chosen, prioritized, planned, tracked, and communicated
subcategories.ID.RA-07: Changes and exceptions are managed, assessed for risk impact, recorded, and tracked
subcategories.ID.RA-08: Processes for receiving, analyzing, and responding to vulnerability disclosures are established
subcategories.ID.RA-09: The authoritativeness and credibility of threat intelligence sources are established and maintained
subcategories.ID.RA-10: Critical suppliers are assessed prior to acquisition

ID.IM.name: Improvement
ID.IM.description: The organization's CSRM processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

subcategories.ID.IM-01: Cybersecurity risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
subcategories.ID.IM-02: Cybersecurity risk management processes are integrated into broader enterprise risk management processes
subcategories.ID.IM-03: The organization's determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector-specific risk analysis
subcategories.ID.IM-04: An organizational approach to cybersecurity roles and responsibilities is established and communicated

pr.name: Protect
pr.description: Safeguards are implemented to limit or contain the impact of potential cybersecurity events

PR.AA.name: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control
PR.AA.description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities is limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed throughout the lifecycle of these users, processes, and devices

subcategories.PR.AA-01: Identities and credentials for authorized users are established, provisioned, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for physical and logical assets
subcategories.PR.AA-02: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials based on the organization's risk management strategy
subcategories.PR.AA-03: Users, assets, and other subjects are authenticated prior to being granted access to systems and assets
subcategories.PR.AA-04: Identity assertions are protected, conveyed, and verified during access control decisions
subcategories.PR.AA-05: Access grants are time-bounded, risk-based, and need-to-know
subcategories.PR.AA-06: Physical and logical access to assets is revoked promptly when no longer needed

PR.AT.name: Awareness and Training
PR.AT.description: The organization's personnel are provided cybersecurity awareness education and training so that they can perform their cybersecurity-related activities

subcategories.PR.AT-01: Personnel are trained to perform their cybersecurity-related duties and responsibilities consistent with organizational policies, standards, and procedures
subcategories.PR.AT-02: Individuals in specialized roles or with significant cybersecurity responsibilities are provided role-appropriate cybersecurity training

PR.DS.name: Data Security
PR.DS.description: Data is protected through appropriate measures throughout the data lifecycle and across all data states

subcategories.PR.DS-01: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-at-rest are protected
subcategories.PR.DS-02: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-transit are protected
subcategories.PR.DS-03: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-use are protected
subcategories.PR.DS-04: Availability of critical services is protected against degradation or failure
subcategories.PR.DS-05: Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties
subcategories.PR.DS-06: The integrity of software, firmware, and information is verified using integrity verification mechanisms
subcategories.PR.DS-07: The development and testing environments are separate from production, and access to each is managed
subcategories.PR.DS-08: Hardware integrity is protected, verified, and maintained
subcategories.PR.DS-09: The confidentiality of backup data is protected

PR.IP.name: Information Protection Processes and Procedures
PR.IP.description: Security policies, processes, and procedures are established, maintained, and applied to protect information and technology assets

subcategories.PR.IP-01: Policies, standards, procedures, and other guidance for protecting information systems and assets are established, maintained, and executed
subcategories.PR.IP-02: System development lifecycle processes include security considerations
subcategories.PR.IP-03: Configuration change control processes and procedures are in place and executed
subcategories.PR.IP-04: Information system and asset configurations are established, documented, implemented, maintained, and reviewed
subcategories.PR.IP-05: Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets are met
subcategories.PR.IP-06: Secure software development practices are integrated, and their performance is monitored throughout the software development life cycle
subcategories.PR.IP-07: The organization's security testing program includes the use of various testing techniques, and findings are remediated
subcategories.PR.IP-08: Incident response plans and other cybersecurity plans that affect operations are established, communicated, maintained, and improved
subcategories.PR.IP-09: Response and recovery plans are tested and improved

PR.MA.name: Maintenance
PR.MA.description: Maintenance and repairs of organizational assets are performed and logged, with approved and controlled tools

subcategories.PR.MA-01: System maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair are performed using approved and controlled tools
subcategories.PR.MA-02: Remote system maintenance and diagnostics activities are approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access

PR.PT.name: Protective Technology
PR.PT.description: Technical security solutions are implemented and managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets

subcategories.PR.PT-01: System and network security architectures are established, documented, maintained, and reviewed
subcategories.PR.PT-02: System security configurations are established, documented, implemented, maintained, and reviewed
subcategories.PR.PT-03: System security capabilities (e.g., logging, monitoring, alerting) are implemented, managed, and improved
subcategories.PR.PT-04: System and network communications are protected
subcategories.PR.PT-05: Mechanisms are implemented to achieve resilience requirements during normal operations and in adverse situations

de.name: Detect
de.description: Activities are implemented to identify the occurrence of cybersecurity events in a timely manner

DE.AE.name: Anomalies and Events
DE.AE.description: Anomalous activity is detected and analyzed, and event impact is understood

subcategories.DE.AE-01: Networks, systems, and assets are monitored to identify potentially malicious activity
subcategories.DE.AE-02: Potentially malicious activity is analyzed to understand impact and to determine if it is an incident
subcategories.DE.AE-03: Information from detection activities is shared appropriately
subcategories.DE.AE-04: The estimated impact and scope of incidents are understood
subcategories.DE.AE-05: Incident alerting and reporting processes are established
subcategories.DE.AE-06: Detection activities comply with all applicable requirements

DE.CM.name: Continuous Security Monitoring
DE.CM.description: Assets are continuously monitored to identify events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures

subcategories.DE.CM-01: Networks and network services are monitored
subcategories.DE.CM-03: Software and the runtime environment are monitored for anomalous behavior
subcategories.DE.CM-05: External service provider activities on the organization's networks are monitored
subcategories.DE.CM-06: Monitoring for unauthorized mobile code is performed
subcategories.DE.CM-07: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, hardware, connections, devices, and software is performed
subcategories.DE.CM-08: Vulnerability assessments are performed and findings remediated according to organizational priorities
subcategories.DE.CM-09: Computing hardware and software, runtime environments, and their configurations are monitored

rs.name: Respond
rs.description: Activities are implemented to take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident

RS.RP.name: Response Planning
RS.RP.description: Response activities are planned, managed, and coordinated with internal and external stakeholders

subcategories.RS.RP-01: A response plan that addresses roles, responsibilities, and communication protocols during and after an incident is developed and implemented
subcategories.RS.RP-02: System capabilities and organizational processes that support incident response are established
subcategories.RS.RP-03: Response plan and associated communications are communicated to impacted stakeholders
subcategories.RS.RP-04: Coordination with internal and external stakeholders occurs during incident response activities
subcategories.RS.RP-05: Response plans incorporate lessons learned from previous incidents and exercises

RS.CO.name: Communications
RS.CO.description: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders, as appropriate, to include external support from law enforcement agencies

subcategories.RS.CO-01: A communication plan for incident response that addresses roles, responsibilities, and communication protocols is established and maintained
subcategories.RS.CO-02: Communication with internal and external stakeholders occurs during incidents
subcategories.RS.CO-03: Information is shared with designated internal and external stakeholders
subcategories.RS.CO-04: Coordination with internal and external stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans
subcategories.RS.CO-05: Voluntary information sharing with external stakeholders occurs to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness

RS.AN.name: Analysis
RS.AN.description: Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities

subcategories.RS.AN-01: The impact and scope of incidents are understood
subcategories.RS.AN-02: Evidence related to incidents is collected, analyzed, and preserved
subcategories.RS.AN-03: Analysis is performed to establish what has taken place during an incident and the root cause of the incident
subcategories.RS.AN-04: The estimated impact of incidents guides response activities
subcategories.RS.AN-06: Actions taken during an incident are recorded

RS.MI.name: Mitigation
RS.MI.description: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and resolve the incident

subcategories.RS.MI-01: Incidents are contained using effective containment techniques and technology solutions
subcategories.RS.MI-02: The impact of incidents is reduced through coordinated response activities
subcategories.RS.MI-03: Recovery activities are performed during incidents

rc.name: Recover
rc.description: Activities are implemented to restore capabilities or services that were impaired due to a cybersecurity incident

RC.RP.name: Recovery Planning
RC.RP.description: Recovery activities are planned and implemented to ensure restoration of systems or assets affected by cybersecurity incidents

subcategories.RC.RP-01: Recovery objectives and priorities are established based on applicable laws, regulations, or policies, and organizational risk tolerance
subcategories.RC.RP-02: Recovery objectives are communicated to internal and external stakeholders

RC.IM.name: Improvements
RC.IM.description: Recovery planning and processes are improved by incorporating lessons learned and effective practices into future activities

subcategories.RC.IM-01: Recovery lessons learned are incorporated into updated response and recovery plans
subcategories.RC.IM-02: Recovery strategies and lessons learned are updated based on evaluation of previous recovery activities and changing threat and vulnerability landscapes

RC.CO.name: Communications
RC.CO.description: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties, such as coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors

subcategories.RC.CO-01: Recovery activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors)
subcategories.RC.CO-02: Internal and external stakeholders understand their roles and order of operations during recovery activities
subcategories.RC.CO-03: Recovery activities consider organization and stakeholder needs
subcategories.RC.CO-04: Recovery activities are coordinated with broader incident response, communications, and recovery strategies
